article_title: Jobs Report: Hiring Settles Into Steady Gains
article_text:
U.S. businesses added jobs at a sturdy pace last month, extending the most robust stretch of hiring since before the recession.

The question now: Is this the beginning of a breakout in hiring that will lift wage growth and finally bring unemployment down to levels consistent with a healthy economy?

In all, employers ranging from retail...

twitter.description: Hiring by U.S. employers remained robust in July, if a bit slower than previous months, with a broad-based rise in payrolls extending a half-year streak of strong employment gains. The jobless rate ticked up to 6.2%.
twitter.creator: @BenLeubsdorf
